column4: i just added a second hard drive i had to use the jsata off my mb to hook it up but now its not detected?
is it detected by the bios ?
you need to have it detected in the bios first,  if your other drive is not sata you may need to set a jumper , check your mobo manual
I have both sata and ide hdd on my comp and I have no problems, I also have 2 ide dvd-rw
it just worked,  did you just install the sata ?
the sata is enabled and not visible in the bios ???? , check your mobo's manual see if you have a jumper so set or something
can you use it to boot from in the bios ( I know there i nothing on it jet I jsut want to know if it is available)

untill you can get your bios to see your sata it will not be available in ubuntu,  try checking the jumpers on the hdd as well , I think you need to set them to master,  or try taking out the jumper alltogether
are you listening ?  take the sata hdd out and theck the jumpers on it
not quite what you were suppose to look for
was there a jumper on the sata hdd ?  I don'T need to know how it was set  I just want to know if there is one

ok then,  I suggest you take your comp to a store and have them give it a shot  preferably the store where you bought and /or the computer,  there is little else we can do for you here , and it's a bit off topic anyway
questions regarding azureus are better directed to #azureus-support
slave hdd are always read write , ifyou can't wite to it from ubuntu is is either because of permission or the filesystem used
